noun.description: The lower or after corner of a sail.
The cords by which a hammock is suspended.
A ball of thread (used especially with reference to the thread supposedly used by Theseus to mark his way out of the Cretan labyrinth).

verb.description: Haul up the clews of a sail to the yard or into the mast ready for furling.

origin: Old English cliwen, cleowen (denoting a rounded mass, also a ball of thread), of Germanic origin; related to Dutch kluwen. All senses are also recorded for the form clue.
